Title: Show that the numerator of $1+\frac12 +\frac13 +\cdots +\frac1{96}$ is divisible by $97$
Content: Let $\frac{x}{y}=1+\frac12 +\frac13 +\cdots +\frac1{96}$ where $\text{gcd}(x,y)=1$. Show that $97\;|\;x$. I try adding these together, but seems very long boring and don't think it is the right way to solving. Sorry for bad english.
AcceptedAnswer:
If you group the fractions in pairs with the first pairing to last, second pairing to next-to-last, etc, you get $$1+\frac 1{96}=\frac {97}{96}, \frac 12+\frac 1{95}=\frac {97}{190}...$$ The sums of these pairs all have a numerator of $97$, and because $97$ is prime the common denominator will not have a factor of 
$97$, so in $\frac xy$, $x$ is a multiple of $97$.
